name: InterContinental Berchtesgaden Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, this hotel is very good. The setting, design, service (mostly) very good, best egg benedicts I have ever eaten. But there are just some things, that shouldn't occur in a Hotel when chipping almost $500 a night:
reviews.title: Very good, but definitely not excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) We ordered a burger and a club sandwich at the Bar at noon. We were the only patrons there. It took almost 40 minutes for our food to arrive. The food was very good, but after we completly finished eating, we didn't see a waiter for another half hour and couldn't ask vor the check!
reviews.title: Faultless Hotel

reviews.text: 2) We called down for our car about 15 minutes before leaving the room. After we got to the front desk and waited outside for another 10 minutes, still no car. I had to ask the bell staff, and no one knew about bringing it up.
reviews.title: I didn´t mind the weather
Glorious if you don't mind spooky history
reviews.text: 3) SPA: The Spa is beautifull and mostly clean. What we completly don't understand, is since having an indoor and outdoor pool, there was NO jacuzzi. This makes you wonder who planned this thing.
4) The pool should be kept cleaner. All areas under water between the tiles are black!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel
Top class
reviews.text: This is really a top class hotel. My husband and I stayed two nights in a panorama suite. The suite was very large and luxurious with stunning views of the surrounding mountains. Most impressive feature was the really fantastic bathroom with a large walk in rain shower, large spa bath, double vanity with generous Molton Brown toiletries, and, last but not least, a window so you had a view while sitting in the bath! The bed was comfortable though, like everywhere in Germany they provide down duvets which I find too hot in summer.
Another outstanding point was the service provided by every staff member I had dealings with.
reviews.title: Not for non smokers

likes.liked: — the views and the peace and quiet
likes.disliked: — poor attitude to non smokers and lack of choice for vegetarian meals

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was expensive but it was lavish and set you up for the day so you could skip lunch.
reviews.title: Just great !

reviews.text: I would recommand this hotel to anyone, be it business or a special treat in an area of outstanding natural beauty.
reviews.title: Best hotel all around

reviews.text: Just been reminded by a similar experience elsewhere in another 5* in Germany how unpleasant the restaurant manager was when I asked why there was no non smoking section in their huge restaurant in the evening. This spoilt a lovely 5 day visit rather than the rain!
reviews.title: Wunderbar!

reviews.text: You will really feel that you are special person during your stay at the hotel. Everything was perfect, the rooms, food. Services and the location. The hotel is in the middle of Berchtesgaden national park where you will be surrounded by the mountains and it is only 20 minutes drive to Salzburg Austria (old town) and the beautiful part of Germany and Austria.
reviews.title: I will never forget it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff of the hotel are very nice people and ready to help you when ever you ask for it.
reviews.title: Good views but mediocre service

reviews.text: The Hotel is really excellent for the family as they have number of activities for all ages within the hotel and around the area.
reviews.title: Perfect for Evert thing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Strongly recommended
reviews.title: After a stay Zum Turcken, you cannot believe the Interconti is on the same planet...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located about 6 km outside the centre of Berchtesgaden. There is no public transport nearby, so unless you are traveling by car you may find it a little difficult to get around. The location is good for hikers, however, and several marked walking routes pass by the hotel.
reviews.title: Loved staying here

reviews.text: This is a great hotel and one that deserves it Leading Hotel Status. The rooms were great with fantastic views and the service was excellent. The food was of a very high standard and catered very well for children although not many seemed to stay here. The spa is lovely but treatments get booked up very fast and it is probably best to book them before you arrive if you can. In fact it was almost faultless. My only tiny quibbles were being charged for the internet and for parking in their underground car park which just seemed petty for such a prestigious hotel. Overall though very highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in just outside the village of Berchtesgaden, about 30-50 minutes from Salzburg. It is easy to find up a steep road from the village. The signpost from the steep road can easily be missed as you are busy keeping the car on the road. Once in the hotel nothing is too much trouble for the staff as you would expect in a hotel of this category. The rooms are large and we have a lovely view over the hotel gardens to the Eagles Nest in the near distance. There is a large fitness area and spa with an outdoor and indoor pool. There are four restaurants in the hotel, including the bar and the food looked good in all of them. We ate in the bar and one restaurant and had a lovely meal. Most of the guests were German during our stay but all the staff spoke very good English. It was an enjoyable start to our holiday.
reviews.title: Luxury in the mountains

likes.disliked: — the pool was a little small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situated 15 miles from Salzburg airport and built over Bormans bunker the views are amazing. The outdoor heated pool gives you views of the mountains and is truely relaxing. The food is very good and the service is attentive. Be warned the sun on a summer evening can be blinding in the mid evening in the restaurant
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service in the Hotel is hit and miss.
reviews.title: Service is hit and miss

reviews.text: Front desk is more "Sorry sir" and not "Certainly" or "I will ry".
reviews.title: What an experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say to describe this wonderful property. The room, the view, the staff, and the food were 5 stars all the way. We particularly enjoyed sitting on the terrace, enjoying the superb buffet breakfast and breathtaking view. The hotel is quite a way out of town, but does have 3 different restaurants. The main reason we came to Berchtesgaden was to take the boat ride on Konigssee in the National Park. Don't miss it, it is something you will always remember
reviews.title: A place to remember

likes.disliked: — Paying for Parking in the middle of no where

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All I can say is that there are not enough superlatives in the dictionary that would do justices to this hotel. It really is worthy of it’s 5 stars. The location is breath taking the views are insurmountable, the quality of the fresh mountain air is remarkable. The Spa is first class with two summing pools one indoors and one outside that is heated all year. I must return to this hotel when it is snowing to try the out door pool. The staff are all first class and very helpful. The room was very well equipped with a free mini bar of soft drinks and once again brilliant views of the mountains. They have three different restaurants one high class, a medium and a bar type. I ate in the Bavarian bar and it could have been better the food was not worthy of writing about it was normal hotel quality food and the service was similar. On the other hand the 360 restaurant was very good with first class service they were very attentive and the food was marvellous very well presented and truly mouth watering in a marvellous setting if the weather is good enough you must eat outside. I would defiantly return and would have liked to have had a third night so as to try their top class restaurant. The one question I have of this hotel is why is it so quite there was hardly anyone there. We had the swimming pools to ourselves and the restaurant was sparsely populated.
reviews.title: Marvellous

reviews.text: The hotel is perfectly located and the rooms are great. The spa is also perfect. The bar area with the open fireplace is great, too
reviews.title: Good hotel in Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurants were good - we did not visit Restaurant THE CIEL but it also looked excellent.
reviews.title: No better place in the Alps

reviews.text: I did not like the arcitecture of the hotel. It seemed to me little bit to dark for this mountain area.
reviews.title: 3rd try - but hotel business is still people business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the world's most stunning locations - be sure to go the extra mile and pay for an outstanding view from your bedroom - don't compromise.
reviews.title: Outstanding - with a couple of watch-outs

reviews.text: On the 'get what you pay for' basis, this is an expensive hotel, and justifiably so.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel - Service leaves to be desired

reviews.text: Particularly worth a mention (in addition to location and views) are the spa and gym, the lounge and bar areas, the six-star breakfast, and the truly excellent seven-star dinner service in the restaurant, where the chef'ing and waiting standards are really exceptional and a credit to IC Hotels and to German standards,.
reviews.title: One of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only a few minor issues for the management to consider...
reviews.title: Excellent hotel but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. We do not speak much German - when we checked in, the reception staff's knowledge of English and ability to explain the hotel's amenities, and the key features of Berchtesgaden and the Eagle's Nest, were not good enough - the concierge who garaged our car was more communicative;
reviews.title: I really like this hotel.

reviews.text: What else to add to the previous reviews? Hard to find any faults - TV channels weren't all that clear, and there seemed to be no radio reception, only the possibility to listen to selected CDs (via the TV system) at 3 EUR apiece. Otherwise, everything was absolutely gorgeous. The spa area with inside and outside pools a dream - beautiful water that did not smell of chlorine. Several saunas and steam bath, visited by people in various stages of dressed or undressed: bathing suit, bikini, or nothing. Very good conference facilities with daylight and mountain views. Incredible amounts of lovely food during the conference breaks. The only thing the visitor should be aware of: it is away from the town, there is nothing around except the documentation center and lots of landscape. Bus to town runs infrequently, so a cab is advised. There should be a hotel shuttle - but maybe there even is. The best place I have stayed at so far!
reviews.title: Another 5-star review

likes.disliked: — View, which was nicer from other rooms

reviews.text: Just can't say enough about this hotel, so will stick to what really stood out. I have earned about 150,000 points with IC this year, so had a few to use a great choice. We were upgraded to a 2 storey suite, which is what the photos are of. The hotel is modern, but not trendy. It is warm and also friendly. The staff are simply the best we have ever seen (and my wife is a hotel manager!). Playing chess with my son by the fire, swimming through to the outside in the pool, the amazing spa, excellent food...what can I say. 25 minutes outside of Salzburg (lovely Austrian city)...and an hour north of where we went skiing (althoug you can also ski at this hotel). Run there. Now.
reviews.title: WOW...best ever...

likes.disliked: — business centre locked most of the time so had to ask for access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is wunderbar! We stayed two nights here and would have stayed another week if we had the time. This is a new resort, exquisitely designed with a modern alpine style - lots of wood, stone, large spaces and great views within a horseshoe-shaped building. No doubt this property will soon be featured in the pages of high-end travel magazines. Our room was large with a very comfortable bed, flat screen television and lovely balcony with courtyard and partial mountain view. The bathroom was beautiful with lots of stone and glass, but the overall lighting could have been slightly better. We wore the provided robes and slippers to the spa downstairs. The indoor pool was tepid and we followed up our swim with a few sessions in two saunas (different temperatures), a fantastic steam room and a unique meditation room with water mattresses. Our only major disappointment was finding the proclaimed heated outdoor pool closed for renovation. We dined at the hotel for one lunch and one dinner - both were excellent. The staff were exceptionally friendly, happy and easy to converse with. The lounge and library were nice in the evening with a piano player and a truly diverse collection of whiskeys and cocktails. If you stay here, consider taking a car or be prepared to pay between 10 and 15 euros for taxis to and from the center of Berchtesgaden (the hotel is well up the hill from the village). Also, review your bill carefully upon check-out as they had included two incorrect checks/charges. These were removed without a problem. Overall, a stunning property in a very scenic and historic place. We will definitely go back.
reviews.title: Good Gaden!

reviews.text: What a wonderful Hotel - absolutely gorgeous. Staff very attentive, food lovely (although have had better apart from the breakfasts which you pay for but are well worth it) swimmingpool/sauna/spa very luxurious and the rooms themselves which are lovely. Cant make any other comment other than what has been mentioned already - vis smoking though - lots of people were smoking in the restaurants although we could never smell anything thank goodness. Bar area and lounge is great too and they have Germany's largest whiskey collection - very impressive. The only thing I would advise however is a car as you are up in the mountains and the bus service is sporadic. Wish too that we had left more time for the Dokumentations centre nearby - fascinating. A ski resort in winter and a 9 hole golfcourse in summer. WE are definitely going back as we had such a wonderful time.
reviews.title: Dont tell everyone how fabulous this place is

reviews.text: This resort must be experienced to be believed! Our teenage daughter has stayed in 5 star places right round the world, but the Inter Continental Resort Berchtesgaden even wowed her! The views are magnificent. The service is superb. The facilities are first class. The indoor and outdoor pools are marvellous. Other hoteliers should check this place out, to set their aim higher! Stay at least 3 days - we found 2 not long enough!
reviews.title: The first resort!
Relax, relax and relax some more
reviews.text: While in the middle of nowhere the hotel is an oasis with large rooms (358), nice views, good food and and spa. Breakfast ain't cheap but it's a sprawling selection of fruit, yogurt, cheese, tea, waffles, eggs, wurst, grains and even Sekt. The campus of the hotel offers jogging routes and hiking. After a long day the spa has several relax rooms with herbs and water beds and even a meditation gong. Coming for the gong is worth it alone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this Hotel during our honeymoon in Austria and it is simply amazing. The location on top of the hill overlooking Berchtesgaden is beautiful and their spa area with the outdoor pool right in between the mountains outstanding. The hotel staff was very friendly and the food was great. Only the room service took almost an hour and the internet in the rooms did not seem to work properly but when mentioned at the reception the extra charges for internet were taken off accordingly. The breakfast buffet is very good and they even have certaing things for people with gluten or milk allergies. It was a great stay and as activities I can really recommend the salt mine in the valley as well es the Enzian Schnaps Brewery tour.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed at, and reviewed, this hotel once before- a few years ago.
reviews.title: Another great stay at IC Berchtesgaden Resort

reviews.text: Upon my check-in, I was told that I was greeted by the General Manager, personally, and he welcomed me back, asked if I was satisfied with everything (How could I not be?) and told me to contact him if there were any issues. I found this to be excellent customer service, especially since I had only stayed there once years before.
reviews.title: Stylish luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the staff were fantastic, the hotel was great, spotlessly clean, well maintained and very warm and welcoming.
reviews.title: Breathtaking views

description: Blending harmoniously into its natural environs, InterContinental Berchtesgaden Resort lies 1,000 metres (3,281 feet) above sea level on Eckerbichl. Views of the Alps stretch in every direction, with Mount Watzmann striking an impressive pose.
